author: Special to The Sentinel
title: Olivet edges Hope 31-27
text: By Special to The Sentinel Holland Sentinel By Special to The Sentinel Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 9:05 PM Updated at 9:05 PM By Special to The Sentinel Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 9:05 PM Holland, Mich. Junior Zac Boersema ran for a career-high 128 yards and three touchdowns for the Hope College football team in a 31-27 loss at unbeaten Olivet College on Saturday, Oct. 17. The running back from Holland (West Ottawa) scored on runs of 86, 4 and 1 yards against the Michigan Intercollegiate Athletic Association's top rushing defense. Olivet answered Boersema's 1-yard score with 3:55 remaining with two touchdowns in a span of 1 minute, 13 seconds. The Comets (6-0, 3-0 MIAA) capitalized on a recovered onside kick with a 50-yard, game-winning drive that ended on Kyle Bryson's 11-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Braden Black. The loss dropped Hope to 2-4 overall and 0-2 in MIAA play. The Flying Dutchmen jumped to a 13-0 lead in the first quarter on Boersema's 86-yard touchdown run and a 16-yard touchdown reception for junior receiver Kurtis Slenk (Holland Christian) from senior quarterback Rob Kish. Olivet scored two second-quarter touchdowns for a 14-13 halftime lead. Boersema's 4-yard score 40 seconds into the fourth quarter capped a 61-yard drive that put the Flying Dutchmen ahead 20-14. Hope recovered its free kick after giving up a safety and went 38 yards in seven plays for Boersema's 1-yard touchdown with 3:55 remaining in fourth quarter. Kish was 18 of 29 passing for 246 yards, a touchdown and an interception. Matt Kroll hauled in nine receptions for 91 yards and Jake Helm (Holland) had four receptions for 84 yards. Junior defensive back Kirk Gibson led the Flying Dutchmen with 11 tackles. Sophomore defensive end Zach Telfor made a career-high nine tackles and a team-high two sacks. Olivet held a slight edge in total offense with 419 yards compared to Hope's 393 yards. Olivet was also 3 for 3 on fourth down conversions. Hope returns to action on Saturday, Oct. 24 for homecoming against Alma. Kickoff is 6 p.m. at Ray & Sue Smith Stadium. By Special to The Sentinel Holland Sentinel By Special to The Sentinel Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 9:05 PM
